DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine buprenorphine hydrochloride ( HCl ) buccal film effective treat opioid-naive subject , moderate severe chronic low back pain ( CLBP ) , require continuous around-the-clock ( ATC ) pain relief extended period time .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study Evaluate Buprenorphine HCl Buccal Film Opioid-Naive Subjects
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis moderate severe low back pain ≥6 month Treating CLBP stable daily maintenance dose nonopioid analgesic medication 10 mg morphine sulfate equivalent ( MSE ) per day ≥4 week . ( Additional need [ PRN ] nonopioid analgesic medication permit top stable daily maintenance dose nonopioid analgesic ) Stable health , determine Principal Investigator Are female practice abstinence use medically acceptable form contraception postmenopausal , biologically sterile , surgically sterile 1 year Willing able comply protocol require visit assessment Current cancer relate pain receive chemotherapy 6 month screen Receiving opioid analgesic medication > 10 mg MSE per day within 28 day screen Subjects history chronic painful condition Reflex sympathetic dystrophy causalgia , acute spinal cord compression , cauda equina compression , acute nerve root compression , meningitis , discitis Allergy contraindication opioid acetaminophen Surgical procedure relief pain 6 month Hypokalemia clinically unstable cardiac disease , include : unstable atrial fibrillation , symptomatic bradycardia , unstable congestive heart failure , active myocardial ischemia QT interval correct use Fridericia 's formula ( QTcF ) ≥450 millisecond 12lead electrocardiogram ( ECG ) History long QT syndrome family member condition Moderate severe hepatic impairment Moderate severe renal impairment Current past history alcohol abuse Positive urine toxicology screen drug abuse History abnormalities physical exam , vital sign , electrocardiogram , laboratory value
